definition: to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: In the reality, it's gonna never happen.
sentences.chinese: 而今害怕那真实得无法挣脱的梦境。

sentences.english: She tried to disengage herself from his grip.
sentences.chinese: 她企图挣脱他的牢牢抓住的手。

sentences.english: Inside every Sancho Panza there's a Don Quixote struggling to get out.
sentences.chinese: 每一个桑丘内心都有一个努力要挣脱出来的唐吉诃德。

sentences.english: This means that he appeared from behind a curtain after he had broken free.
sentences.chinese: 这意味他在挣脱后才会从布幕后出现。

sentences.english: Creativity is a temporary salvation from the claws of death.
sentences.chinese: 创造力是一种临时的拯救，从死亡的魔爪中挣脱。

sentences.english: And Lincoln also unscrewed the pipe and unlocked himself.
sentences.chinese: 而林肯也拧开了管子并且挣脱了。

sentences.english: Chen research took the hand of peace, but peace squirmed away.
sentences.chinese: 陈研拉住了和平的手，可是和平却挣脱开了。

sentences.english: A third time he freed himself of his manacles.
How can we escape such useless dichotomies?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎样才能从这些毫无意义的二分法中挣脱出来？

sentences.english: She squirmed out of his arms.
sentences.chinese: 她扭动着挣脱了他的拥抱。

sentences.english: The thief wriggled out of the old man's grip.
sentences.chinese: 小偷从老人的手中挣脱。

sentences.english: Breaketh his rein, and to her straight goes he.
sentences.chinese: 他挣脱缰绳，向母驴直跑。

sentences.english: What were we doing when we unchained this earth from its sun?
sentences.chinese: 当我们让地球挣脱了太阳，我们在干什么？

sentences.english: Runs works loose your rope, retrieves the hope already long freedom.
sentences.chinese: 跑啊挣脱你的绳索，找回渴望已久的自由啊哟。

sentences.english: He could break the fetters of his foes, but not the cords of his own lust"."
sentences.chinese: 他能够挣断敌人绑他的麻绳，但不能挣脱情欲的束缚。

definition: the power of sb or sth evil/the clutches (of a bad person etc)
to catch/to grapple with/to hold onto
to relinquish one's grip/to let go
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
to break away/to extricate/to escape/to leave the confines of
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
